newsitem.title: UK: British arms plant raided in Indonesian protest.
newsitem.headline: British arms plant raided in Indonesian protest.

text.p: Nine people were arrested on Monday after breaching security at a factory in southern Britain to protest the export to Indonesia of armoured vehicles and water cannons produced at the plant.
The group said it used paint to mark the items at the Glover Webb facility in Southampton: "Not for Export to Indonesia".

"British water cannon and armoured vehicles were used last year in brutal attacks by the (Indonesian) police that led to many injuries and deaths. We cannot allow the export of more," Angie Zelter, spokeswoman for the group, said.
The company said no completed vehicles were at the site and no real damage had been caused in the raid.
Human rights activists accuse the Indonesian government of gross violations, particularly in East Timor, a former Portuguese colony invaded by Indonesia in 1975.
Three refugees from East Timor participated in Monday's protest, Zelter said.
